reviewText: I was very pleased with the purchase of this movie.  It was pretty good in terms of thrills and romance.  Tom Berenger is a detective who is assigned to guard a Manhattan socialite after she witnesses the death of a friend.  The killer begins to close in on her and soon Tom Berenger's own family and marriage are at risk.  The plot moved a little slowly at times but it did build up to a big climatic finish.  The characters in this film have great chemistry and I enjoyed the storyline very much.  Plus, this movie was directed by Ridley Scott.  A good 1980's film.

reviewText: This movie somehow got overlooked in theatres, but there's no need to miss it now.Long story short: Rich socialite Mimi Rogers witnesses a mob hit and thus becomes a target.  Tom Berenger is a blue-collar cop assigned to protect her.  He is attracted to her, but is married (to Lorraine Bracco, playing the same character she always played before The Sopranos).  Complicating matters is that she is attracted to him and the intense situation is constantly pushing them together.What sets "Someone..." apart from other movies with similar plots is that Bracco's character is pretty sympathetic so it's not a cut-and-dried issue.  Berenger is drawn to Rogers because she is a vulnerable woman who needs protection.  Bracco's character is a strong, independent Brooklynite who can challenge him in the relationship, but can't provide the one thing he needs (a chance to be needed).  High-concept stuff when you think about it.All of this romance is sandwiched in between a pretty good thriller as Berenger attempts to protect Rogers from some very bad guys.  The thriller-story is what the movie was sold on and it succeeds on that level.The DVD offers some good extras, but nothing inventive.Don't miss this one a second time.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this movie and nobody but the then stunningly gorgeous and also damn sweet and cute Tom Berenger could have pulled it off. Infidelity in movies or real life depresses me, but hey, without it there would be no movie. mike's inner torment is what makes this great. He wants to do the right thing but he just cannot stay away from Claire and her world that is so different than his. I can think of few times in movies when I have seen that kind of electricity as the very first time mike sees Claire. Wow. The sexual tension builds beautifully and of course culminates. I wish we had been able to see a liitle more sex scene. I mean, we cut from the first kiss to him fully dressed and kissing her goodbye. After that all we ever get is them in bed but they are sleeping or he is thinking or whatever. I am not saying I wanted porn. But just a little more action...they were so sexy and cute together in large part because of their different worlds.  The slow dancing scene at the end...Yowza. Now THAT was sexy with all clothes on.  They clearly had feelings for each other still. He looked like he was about to cry. So tender. Yes yes I swoon for the old Tom Berenger. I even thought sgt. Barnes in platoon was hot, and see Betrayed if you REALLY want him hot.

reviewText: The plot in this film has been used many times with small variations that make it worthwhile to watch: a poor, good looking detective from a nice warm family with an adoring wife is assigned to watch and protect a beautiful, rich woman, and the two fall in love. Tom Berringer is the man in this movie, Mini Rogers the socialite, Loraine Bracco the wife, and the late Jerry Orbach from Law and Order is Tom's lieutenant, unfortunately without his trademark Law and Order wisecracks.In this 1987 version of the oft-told plot, a socialite sees a brutal gangster knife a man and says she can identify him. Orbach orders Berringer to "baby sit her," which includes being at her house at night while she is in bed. Berringer lives with his charming wife and outgoing, smiling son in a run-down house in a bad and dangerous neighborhood. The socialite's house is larger than a mansion. She is beautiful. The gangster finds a way to get to her and threatens her, but she nevertheless identifies him in a lineup. But he is released because Berringer did not read him the Miranda warning. The socialite is outraged, screams at Berringer, they kiss, and sleep together. When he returns home, he finds two police officers; his wife heard a prowler outside during the night.Berringer's wife suspects what is happening to her husband and throws him out of their run-down home when she sees him wearing a tie that the socialite bought him and hearing him begin to complain about her New York accent, which he enjoyed during their sixteen year marriage.The problems heat up when the gangster sends a henchman to the socialite's mansion to kill her, and reaches a boiling point when the gangster goes to Berringer's home, holds his wife and son captive, and insists that Berringer come home alone. But the socialite goes with him.Viewers will find it interesting to watch the violence at the mansion when the henchman creeps in to kill the socialite, and the ferocity at Berringer's home and how his wife and son act. They will also be fascinated watching what happens to the gangster, Berringer, his wife, his son, and the socialite.
summary: An exiting version of an oft-told tale
Title: N/A

reviewText: Tom Berenger is sensational in this romantic thriller movie from director Ridley Scott.  He plays Mike Keegan, a newly promoted detective, who is given the assignment of (as the police put it)"babysitting" the witness to a brutal murder.  The witness, Claire Gregory, played to the hilt by Mimi Rogers, is beautiful, classy and well-educated.  She's especially upset because she's just seen a close friend get stabbed to death. These actors have real screen chemistry (it's not forced) which makes the movie work.  While Mike Keegan is attracted to Claire from the minute he sees her, he tries to keep those feelings at bay and just be professional. However, the more time he spends with her, the harder that becomes. Lorraine Bracco is one tough cookie and does a wonderful job of playing a police officer's wife. The "perp", played by Andreas Katsulas, is really scary; he does a great job playing a psychopathic killer.  All in all, a very talented cast, great plot with suspense and a taut feeling throughout really combine to make this an outstanding movie. When you think about it, we all need "someone to watch over us" and that movie really makes that come through.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very good movie.  Ridley Scott has created a 100% authentic world with this movie.  Tom Berenger plays his character fantastically.  It's really a shame that he lost his talent to low rent action films when he could've continued with films like this.  The atmosphere and cinemotography, as well as the soundtrack featuring liscensed (?) music really contributes to the overall mood, which is kind of casual and realistic.  One thing that I think is good is that the story isn't pushed along by action and violence, it's pushed along by the struggles of Mike Keegan who has just been promoted to Detective, and on his first job as a Detective, his life is ruined.  Recommended to Ridley Scott and 80's film fans alike.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an enjoyable movie if you ignore the simple-minded and logic-deficient "thriller" plot (would that brutal guy REALLY be permitted to run around the city for that long, repeatedly trying to kill witnesses??) and just concentrate on the nicely drawn characterizations of the three main protagonists, with their genuinely complicated emotional dilemmas.  Also, the cinematography and music are top notch, as is the image quality of the DVD.
summary: Watch this for Berenger, Bracco, and Rogers

reviewText: All right, this is a bit of a difficult film to review, because while I enjoyed it, I can't decide whether I would actually want to be bothered to watch it again -- and that usually defines a great movie, for me.  But I'll do my best and we'll see where we go.To sum up the plot, Tom Berenger plays Mike, a happily married (sexy) police detective who's hired to protect Claire (Mimi Rogers), a rich woman who's witnessed a murder.  Predictably, perhaps, Claire and Mike fall in love, and as Mike's marriage begins to fall apart, the murderer steps up his pursuit of Claire in an attempt to find and destroy her...Okay, okay, so it's a bit of an average plot, from the sounds of it.  But the complexity of the storyline and the decent character developments kept me watching.  I actually disliked all the of the performances of the principal actors, but they were probably the only actors for the parts and for each other in this movie.  I like how Mimi Rogers's character likes opera, it gives her this artsy, deep dynamic, but all in all, I wasn't that convinced that her character actually develops beyond "learning not to fall in love with bodyguards."  The same goes for the others.  It's like the plot moves along, but the characters don't quite go with it.Nonetheless!  The actors aren't HORRIBLE, the plot is decent, and Tom Berenger is one hot bodyguard.  Mimi Rogers DOES get the helpless victim act across well, and the set, costumes, etc. are terrific.  The suspense is suspenseful.  The movie will keep you interested.One of the other reviewers of this movie wrote that 'Someone to Watch Over Me' is a good date movie.  It is.  It's definitely worth watching, if you're on a stay-in date, or just in need of a decent movie to kill time, and after watching it you'll feel that the two hours wasn't wasted.  It's worth the $20 or so for the DVD if you like '80s movies; otherwise it's a rental, but a worthwhile one.
summary: Not an Oscar winner, but worth watching

reviewText: Personally speaking, I like a nice fairly straightforward thriller-type movie, with a little suspense, and a little romance, so this was up my ally!  The characters were amazingly well-developed I thought, given the genre, and their situation was really compelling.  Mimi Rogers was wonderful in her role-- not at all the "shallow" socialite stereotype, but a real person with real worries and real needs... Go ahead and check this one out if you're looking for a way to pass an evening!  But get the DVD if you can, I found the VHS to be pretty low quality.
summary: Not a bad movie for a night in front of the TV...

reviewText: Ridley Scott's fourth film has always been a favorite of mine.  A guilty pleasure I guess although I see where it is now at 82% at "Rotten Tomatoes".  The general audience never warmed up to it and I'm not sure why.  The movie grabbed me from the opening scene, scanning the tall monuments of New York City at dusk while Sting sings the title song over the credits.  This is one of 4 version of the song in the film if I'm not mistaken, including the proper coda over the closing credits performed by Roberta Flack.While we're on the subject, STWOM has a varied soundtrack ranging from the several versions of the Gershwins' beautiful song to Steve Winwood's "Freedom Overspill" to Christmas themed chamber music to opera arias that have now become common place.  I'm pretty sure this film is where I first heard music from Catalani's "La Wally" and "Vien Mallika" by Delibes, now staples on my MP3 player.  The filmmakers do a wonderful job placing the music over the proper scene and it adds significantly to the effect.This is probably the first time I saw the gorgeous architectural creation know as the Guggenheim Museum where it is the setting for a chase sequence.  Not the last time either.  Tom Berenger is perfectly suited as the cop from Queens assigned to nighttime duty to protect a beautiful eyewitness (a stone cold gorgeous Mimi Rogers) to a brutal murder.  Claire (Rogers) is filthy rich and has a multi-million dollar Park Ave. apartment.  Michael (Berenger) is clearly wowed by Claire's sophistication, intellect and beauty not to mention her surroundings and influence.  This is a different world.  There is a scene where Mike and his saucy wife Ellie (terrific Lorraine Bracco) are looking out from their humble home in Queens toward the Manhattan skyline.  If only.Happily married though he is, Michael comes under the spell of the forbidden fruit that is Claire.  The sets of her apartment are perfectly toned in browns, beiges, tans, egg shell whites and creams.  A sense of calm, that Mike's usually hurried life denies him.  Claire is rich, beautiful and available.  Yes, I'm sucked in too.  The film doesn't minimize the thriller aspect either.  Claire is set upon by the killer and his henchmen more than once.  There is an intense scene in the final act that adds to ultimate conclusion.  "Someone To Watch Over Me" remains a great blend of drama, romance and modern film noir.

reviewText: Out of all of the Ridley Scott movies that I have seen, this is the worst of them. Don't get me wrong, it's still a good movie, but compared to Gladiator or Blade Runner this is nothing.  I'm also not a big fan of Tom Berenger, he doesn't seem to come off very believable in his movies and that is why he only does straight-to-video movies now.  Mimi Rogers is all right, she seemed like a real person in a real situation.  The story is also well developped, my only problem was the length of the film which is approximately 95 minutes. Other Ridley Scott films that you should check out if you liked this: White Squall, Thelma & Louise and G.I. Jane.
summary: Not an great Ridley Scott film

reviewText: I rented it once, loved it and bought the DVD, with remastered soundtrack.  A fan of the film noir genre, I noticed the cliches, but didn't care one whit about them.  The acting, the "feel" of NYC, the contrasts between the main characters, I love all of it.  Tom Berenger is perfectly cast, as well as Mimi Rogers, a favorite of mine.  A romantic at heart, every time I watch this movie, I envision, Part 2, and continue with the characters' lives: what if Mike's wife finally gave him the boot and Claire sent Mike an address from abroad?  Can't help but love a film that makes me wonder, "what if?" at the end.  I never want the movie to end.  I also enjoy watching Claire and her classy wardrobe.  This is a guilty pleasure for me, as is "Flashdance."  However, it is far superior to "Flashdance."  "Someone" is a beautiful mood film from Ridley Scott.  I just need the soundtrack now!
summary: One Movie I Never Tire of Seeing
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw this movie in the 80's when it was in the theatres.  It celebrated all that the decade was known for:  glamour, over-the-top consumerism, women moving into the professions in a big way, etc.The female lead couldn't just live in a nice apartment -- it had to be one with a private elevator, several thousand sq. ft., panoramic views of the New York skyline, a chauffeur was standard among her and her friends.  She wears great clothes, natch!The plot needed to use all these elements but to give it some edge there had to be a murder (gory is best), she had to see it happen (the only witness), a police officer from the other end of the economic scale had to be put in charge of protecting the key witness -- you get the idea . . .The inevitable sexual attraction between princess and pauper happens, of course.  But he's married (of course) to a former police officer, has a son, etc. . . .There were a number of films of that era which followed closely that plot line -- "Witness" with Harrison Ford, "Fatal Attraction" with Glenn Close, you can probably think of others.For an evening's entertainment, it's great eye-candy !!
summary: A bit dated, but still entertaining

reviewText: The premise: woman sees murder murderer chases her and tries to kill her police watch her and protect her.But the actual movie plot was about a family man who lusts after a woman and a shallow life of things and money. He is "seduced" by it. So he wrecks his family in the process.That's pretty much it. Not much more too it. I mean Mimi Rogers plays the rich bee well . . . . She looks the part. The manhattan apt is beautiful, even by today's standards. Berenger has a good accent going. I mean you could have seen/heard that in a 5 minute behind the scenes audition tape. There wasn't even any suspense. Even the "suspenseful" parts didn't have you on the edge of your seat.So why bother?
summary: another waste of time forget me movie

reviewText: The story is very simple. Rich lady witnesses murder. Police guy watches over her. They fall for each other. Police guy is married. I think, for the amount of time the story has to unfold, we don't get the sense Berenger ever really develops as a full character. I love Ridley Scott's style, though I think this one was more noir then the story would lend itself to be. Overall, a good watch on a slow night.
